key_facts: India's Kumbh Mela is the largest religious gathering in the world.
Kumbh Mela has raised environmental concerns due to its scale.
The event strains water resources and increases pollution in the Ganges River.
Spiritual leaders promoted environmental awareness at Kumbh Mela.
Religious figures partnered with UNEP to advocate for climate action.
Faith-based education was used to engage communities on climate issues.
Experts say religious leaders can bridge the gap between science and the public.
India faces severe climate-related events like heatwaves and floods.
Climate events threaten national security and livelihoods in India.
Faith leaders committed to adopting eco-friendly practices.
Faith leaders continue to advocate for long-term sustainability.
